radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Ultrasonography of the abdomen and uterus
radiographic_examinations.findings: Moderate amount of maternal peritoneal fluid and a small pleural effusion on the left side; gallbladder appeared normal.
Subsegmental atelectasis in the lung bases and no evidence of free air in the upper abdomen.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Repeat chest radiograph showed subsegmental atelectasis in the lower lobe of the left lung.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT scan of the abdomen and pelvis
radiographic_examinations.findings: Minimal bibasilar linear atelectasis; minimal fluid around a nondistended gallbladder; enlarged, heterogeneous, and hypervascular postpartum uterus; moderate amount of free intraperitoneal fluid with a density of 60 Hounsfield units.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: CT scan shows normal, enlarged, hypervascular postpartum uterus, with hyperdense fluid adjacent to it.
